body.message:
Analyzed entities: @{outputs('Compose_response')['AnalyzedEntities']}
Maximum Global Prevalence: @{outputs('Compose_response')['MaximumGlobalPrevalence']}
Minimum Global Prevalence: @{outputs('Compose_response')['MinimumGlobalPrevalence']}
Number of files found in email attachments: @{outputs('Compose_response')['EntitiesAttachmentCount']}
Number of hashes for files not signed by Microsoft: @{outputs('Compose_response')['HashesNotMicrosoftSignedCount']}
Number of hashes with no or invalid signatures: @{outputs('Compose_response')['HashesInvalidSignatureCount']}
Number of hashes linked to known threats: @{outputs('Compose_response')['HashesLinkedToThreatCount']}
List of these threats: @{if(equals(length(variables('HashesThreatList')),0),'No threats found',body('Create_HTML_table_for_threats'))}
Details for files: @{if(equals(length(variables('FileResults')),0),'No attachment files found',body('Create_HTML_table_for_files'))}
Details for hashes: @{if(equals(length(variables('FileHashResults')),0),'No hashes found',body('Create_HTML_table_for_hashes'))}

Compose_KQL_for_EmailAttachmentInfo_with.inputs:
EmailAttachmentInfo
| where Timestamp > ago(30d)
| where FileName=~ "@{items('For_each_File')['RawEntity']['friendlyName']}"
| summarize FirstSeen=min(Timestamp), LastSeen=max(Timestamp), Count=count() by FileName,SHA256, FileSize

EmailAttachmentInfo
| where Timestamp > ago(30d)
| where SHA256 =~ "@{items('For_each_FileHash')['RawEntity']['hashValue']}"
| summarize FirstSeen=min(Timestamp), LastSeen=max(Timestamp), Count=count() by FileName,SHA256, FileSize

HTTP_query_the_EmailAttachmentInfo_table.description: Will fail on purpose when SHA256 is not the algorithm, it will use a null URI
